messages.message: Hi team, if I should be asking this somewhere else, please let me know and I will x-post. Nationwide is asking if it’s possible for us to enable enforced mTLS encryption for all api calls that they make to our system. They are in a single-tenant AIHub environment, so this wouldn’t interfere with other tenants, but it’s obviously not something that we support at present. Is this something we can roadmap, or something that we have already roadmapped? I think the issue is rather complex as our internal applications use the same api endpoints as external calls use :disappointed:  cc @Alex Sgueglia @Atul Grover

i haven't heard of anything like this on the roadmap

cc @hannah

> I think the issue is rather complex as our internal applications use the same api endpoints as external calls use
:100: bc of this, i think this will require a lot of effort :disappointed:
Adding in @Jason and @Josh Rad to look into this
We have done this before with the mTLS only applied to the nginx rules for api-server but I need to double check that. At a minimum, we could set up a config test. How urgent is this?

@Alex Sgueglia can speak better to the urgency but it seems like something Nationwide 100% wants before go live.

I think if we just apply rules for api-server we'd still have issues, but we could restrict access to the /API endpoints to internal traffic and make mirrored endpoints in nginx config that sit at something like /apiext ? Depending on how the reverse proxy is working that may be sufficient. Patching nginx-conf is also really not stable still also, when it comes to issues caused by upgrades, so we'd need to figure that out as well
Mm actually because the web browser handles API calls for the frontend, that wouldnt work either :thinking_face:

Yes this seems like a hard requirement for go-live for some of the use cases. These use cases are just starting the development phase, but I’m unsure if mtls is a blocker for developing these integrations or only for go-live. @Atul Grover do you know?
